PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: image_search()

```

```

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)

## Claim
Claim: "The US reinstituted draft in 2024 for the Israel-Hamas war."

## Actions
```
web_search("US draft Israel-Hamas war 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The United Nations News published an article on November 20, 2024, stating that the United States vetoed a UN Security Council draft resolution demanding an immediate and unconditional ceasefire in the Gaza Strip (<image:1>). The Security Council Report published on November 19, 2024, discusses a draft resolution on the war in Gaza between Israel and Hamas. The US was expected to vote on the draft resolution on November 20.

The United Nations Security Council failed to adopt a resolution calling for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza due to a veto by the United States on November 20, 2024. The resolution, supported by 14 Council members, also demanded the release of hostages and access to basic services for Gaza's civilian population.

Relevant URLs: [https://news.un.org/en/story/2024/11/1157216](https://news.un.org/en/story/2024/11/1157216), [https://www.securitycouncilreport.org/whatsinblue/2024/11/vote-on-a-draft-resolution-on-the-war-in-gaza.php](https://www.securitycouncilreport.org/whatsinblue/2024/11/vote-on-a-draft-resolution-on-the-war-in-gaza.php), [https://press.un.org/en/2024/sc15907.doc.htm](https://press.un.org/en/2024/sc15907.doc.htm).


## Elaboration
The provided evidence does not contain any information about the US reinstituting the draft in 2024 for the Israel-Hamas war. The evidence focuses on the US vetoing a UN resolution regarding a ceasefire in Gaza.

Therefore, I cannot verify the claim.


## Actions
```
web_search("US military draft history")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conscription_in_the_United_States): 
Content: "that I will bear arms on behalf of the United States when required by the law; that I will perform noncombatant service in the armed forces of the United States when required by the law; that I will perform work of national importance under civilian direction when required by the law;

The [United States Citizenship and Immigration Services](/wiki/United_States_Citizenship_and_Immigration_Services "United States Citizenship and Immigration Services")
 (USCIS) also allows the recital of a "Modified Oath for Religious or Conscientious Objections" with either or both of the clauses "that I will bear arms on behalf of the United States when required by law; that I will perform noncombatant service in the armed forces of the United States when required by law" deleted.[\[157\]](#cite_note-157)

Footnotes
---------

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Conscription_in_the_United_States&action=edit&section=26 "Edit section: Footnotes")\
\]

1. Conscription of 17-year-olds is optional and requires parental consent.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

Conscription has faced strong opposition throughout American history from prominent figures like [Daniel Webster](/wiki/Daniel_Webster "Daniel Webster")
, who stated, "A free government with an uncontrolled power of military conscription is the most ridiculous and abominable contradiction and nonsense that ever entered into the heads of men."[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

History
-------

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Conscription_in_the_United_States&action=edit&section=1 "Edit section: History")\
\]

See also: [Conscientious objection in the United States § History](/wiki/Conscientious_objection_in_the_United_States#History "Conscientious objection in the United States")

### Colonial era to 1862

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Conscription_in_the_United_States&action=edit&section=2 "Edit section: Colonial era to 1862")\
\]

In [colonial times](/wiki/Colonial_history_of_the_United_States "Colonial history of the United States")
, the [Thirteen Colonies](/wiki/Thirteen_Colonies "Thirteen Colonies")
 used a [militia](/wiki/Militia_(United_States) "Militia (United States)")
 system for defense. And when any individual or combination of individuals, undertakes to decide for any man when he shall work, where he shall work, at what he shall work, and for what he shall work, he or they practically reduce him to slavery."[\[15\]](#cite_note-15)

### National Guard

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Conscription_in_the_United_States&action=edit&section=4 "Edit section: National Guard")\
\]

The [Militia Act of 1903](/wiki/Militia_Act_of_1903 "Militia Act of 1903")
 reorganized the federally supported state militias as the National Guard, aligning their training with active duty needs so they could be quickly put into federal service.

In 1933, Congress reorganized the National Guard under its [Article I enumerated power](/wiki/Enumerated_powers_(United_States) "Enumerated powers (United States)")
 to "raise and support armies" instead of its power to "Provide for organizing, arming and disciplining the Militia".[\[16\]](#cite_note-16)
 This avoids the constraint on federal militia service that it can only be used "to execute the laws of the Union, suppress insurrections and repel invasions."

Able-bodied men between the ages of 17 and 45 outside of the National Guard are defined in the Militia Act and under the laws of some states as the [unorganized militia](/wiki/Militia_(United_States)#Unorganized_militia "Militia (United States)")
, which may be called into state or federal service as needed.

### World War I

\[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Conscription_in_the_United_States&action=edit&section=5 "Edit section: World War I")\
\]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/20/King%2C_Stoddard_WW1_draft_card.jpg/250px-King%2C_Stoddard_WW1_draft_card.jpg)](/wiki/File:King,_Stoddard_WW1_draft_card.jpg)

A [World War I](/wiki/World_War_I "World War I")
\-era draft card belonging to writer [Stoddard King](/wiki/Stoddard_King "Stoddard King")

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1c/U.S._draft_lottery.jpg/250px-U.S._draft_lottery.jpg)](/wiki/File:U.S._draft_lottery.jpg)

[Secretary of War](/wiki/Secretary_of_War "Secretary of War")
 [Newton Baker](/wiki/Newton_Baker "Newton Baker")
 draws the first draft number on July 20, 1917

In 1917, the administration of [President](/wiki/President_of_the_United_States "President of the United States")
 [Woodrow Wilson](/wiki/Woodrow_Wilson "Woodrow Wilson")
 decided to rely primarily on conscription, rather than voluntary enlistment, to raise military manpower for [World War I](/wiki/World_War_I "World War I")
 when only 73,000 volunteers enlisted out of the initial 1 million target in the first six weeks of the war.[\[17\]](#cite_note-17)
 One ascribed motivation was to thwart former president [Theodore Roosevelt](/wiki/Theodore_Roosevelt "Theodore Roosevelt")
, who proposed raising a volunteer division, which would have upstaged Wilson. However, there is no evidence that Roosevelt had enough support to carry out that plan, and because Wilson had just started his second term, the former President's prospects for substantial political gain seemed dubious.

The [Selective Service Act of 1917](/wiki/Selective_Service_Act_of_1917 "Selective Service Act of 1917")
 was carefully drawn to remedy the defects in the Civil War system and—by allowing exemptions for dependency, essential occupations, and religious scruples—to place each man in his proper niche in a national war effort.[\[18\]](#cite_note-18)
 The act established a "liability for military service of all male citizens"; authorized a selective draft of all those between 21 and 31 years of age (later from 18 to 45); and prohibited all forms of bounties, substitutions, or purchase of exemptions. Baker")
 created the Board of Inquiry to question the conscientious objectors' sincerity.[\[24\]](#cite_note-FOOTNOTEShenk200562-24)
 [Military tribunals](/wiki/Military_tribunals_in_the_United_States "Military tribunals in the United States")
 tried men found by the Board to be insincere for a variety of offenses, sentencing 17 to [death](/wiki/Capital_punishment "Capital punishment")
, 142 to [life imprisonment](/wiki/Life_imprisonment "Life imprisonment")
, and 345 to [penal labor](/wiki/Penal_labor "Penal labor")
 camps.[\[24\]](#cite_note-FOOTNOTEShenk200562-24)
 Many of these sentences were commuted after the war's end.

In 1917, a number of radicals and [anarchists](/wiki/Anarchists "Anarchists")
, including [Emma Goldman](/wiki/Emma_Goldman "Emma Goldman")
, tried to challenge the new draft law in federal court, arguing that it was a direct violation of the [Thirteenth Amendment](/wiki/Thirteenth_Amendment_to_the_United_States_Constitution "Thirteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution")
's prohibition against [slavery and involuntary servitude](/wiki/Slavery_in_the_United_States "Slavery in the United States")
. Congress further tweaked this act in 1950 although the post–World War II surplus of military manpower left little need for draft calls until [President Truman's](/wiki/Harry_S._Truman "Harry S. On numerous occasions, General Hershey told Congress that for every man drafted, three or four more were scared into volunteering.[\[49\]](#cite_note-49)
[\[50\]](#cite_note-50)
 Assuming that his assessment was accurate, this would mean that more than 11 million men volunteered for service because of the draft between January 1954 and April 1975.[\[29\]](#cite_note-autogenerated2-29)

The policy of using the draft to incentivize voluntary enlistment was unique in American history. During the active combat phase, the possibility of avoiding combat by selecting their service and military specialty led as many as four out of 11 eligible men to enlist.[\[53\]](#cite_note-Useem-53)
[\[54\]](#cite_note-54)
 The military relied upon draft-induced volunteerism to meet its quotas, especially for the Army, which accounted for nearly 95% of all inductees during the Vietnam War era. If drafted, they would only serve for two years, but would have no choice over their military occupational specialty.[\[68\]](#cite_note-68)

Of the nearly 16 million men not engaged in active military service, 96% were exempted (typically because of jobs including other military service), deferred (usually for educational reasons), or disqualified (usually for physical and mental deficiencies but also for criminal records including draft violations).[\[29\]](#cite_note-autogenerated2-29)
 The requirements for obtaining and maintaining an educational deferment changed several times in the late 1960s. Gates initially opposed the all-volunteer army idea but changed his mind during the course of the 15-member commission's work.[\[73\]](#cite_note-aitken-73)
 The Gates Commission issued its report in February 1970, describing how adequate military strength could be maintained without having conscription.[\[71\]](#cite_note-evans-71)
[\[76\]](#cite_note-griffith-76)
 The existing draft law was expiring at the end of June 1971, but the Department of Defense and Nixon administration decided the draft needed to continue for at least some time.[\[76\]](#cite_note-griffith-76)
 In February 1971, the administration requested Congress to extend the draft for two years, to June 1973.[\[77\]](#cite_note-nyt020371-77)
[\[78\]](#cite_note-black-78)

Senatorial opponents of the war wanted to reduce this to a one-year extension, eliminate the draft altogether, or tie the draft renewal to a timetable for troop withdrawal from Vietnam;[\[79\]](#cite_note-nyt060571-79)
 Senator [Mike Gravel](/wiki/Mike_Gravel "Mike Gravel")
 of [Alaska](/wiki/Alaska "Alaska")
 took the most forceful approach, trying to [filibuster](/wiki/Filibuster "Filibuster")
 the draft renewal legislation, shut conscription down, and directly force an end to the war.[\[80\]](#cite_note-80)
 Senators supporting Nixon's war efforts supported the bill even though some had qualms about ending the draft.[\[78\]](#cite_note-black-78)
 After a prolonged battle in the Senate, a September 1971 [cloture](/wiki/Cloture "Cloture")
 was achieved over the filibuster, and the draft renewal bill was approved.[\[81\]](#cite_note-nyt092271-81)
 Meanwhile, military pay was increased as an incentive to attract volunteers, and television advertising for the U.S."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia article "Conscription in the United States" details the history of the draft in the US, including its use in World War I, World War II, the Korean War, and the Vietnam War. It provides statistics on the number of draftees during these conflicts. The article also mentions the Selective Service System and the legal framework for conscription, including the role of the National Guard and the unorganized militia. It does not mention the US reinstituting the draft in 2024.

From [Source](https://warfarehistorynetwork.com/article/to-field-an-army-a-short-history-of-the-draft/): 
Content: "Across the Empire, opposition to the measure was fierce and precipitated unrest in Canada, Australia, New Zealand, and Ireland.

![Unusually well-kempt American draftees report for duty at Fort Slocum, Long Island, during the national call to arms in June 1917.](https://warfarehistorynetwork.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/M-Draft-9-HTFeb08.jpg)

Unusually well-kempt American draftees report for duty at Fort Slocum, Long Island, during the national call to arms in June 1917.

In an effort to bolster the dwindling number of volunteers—only 300,000 had come forward by 1916—the Military Service Act became law in Canada on July 6, 1917. Some were lucky like me, but many, certainly most, were kidnapped by government and compelled, at great cost to serve as quasi-slaves.

Among the first to recognize the need for a standing army (which created, in turn, a need for more troops) was Prussian King Frederick William II, better known to history as Frederick the Great. Illustration appeared in Harper’s Weekly, August 1, 1863.](https://warfarehistorynetwork.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/M-Draft-2-HTFeb08.jpg)

New York City rioters burn and sack the Colored Orphan Asylum on Fifth Avenue and 43rd Street at the height of the rampage. In writing the unanimous opinion of the Court, Justice Oliver Wendell Holmes concluded, “When a nation is at war many things that might be said in time of peace are such a hindrance to its effort that their utterance will not be endured so long as men fight and that no Court could regard them as protected by any constitutional right.”

!

Heavyweight boxing champion Muhammad Ali holds an impromptu press conference in his hometown of Louisville, Kentucky, after refusing to take an induction oath.

### Mobilizing America for the Second World War

After the war, Congress consistently declined to extend the system of military draft or compulsory service. Draftees were sorted into a variety of classifications from I-A, designating those who were fit and available immediately for military service; to I-A-O, which identified a conscientious objector available for military service in a noncombat role; to IV-F, for those who were physically or “morally” unfit. During the Vietnam era, from August 1964 through February 1973, a total of 1,857,304 young American men had been pressed into military service through the Selective Service system.

Although the draft had ended and the American armed forces had become an all-volunteer enterprise, the requirement for young men to register for the draft remained in effect until it was also suspended in April 1975. Whether that has been a fundamental blessing to mankind, or a curse, remains very much an open question.

[Back to the issue this appears in](/issue/military-heritage-february-2008-issue)

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "The US reinstituted draft in 2024 for the Israel-Hamas war."

## Actions
```
web_search("US draft Israel-Hamas war 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The United Nations News published an article on November 20, 2024, stating that the United States vetoed a UN Security Council draft resolution demanding an immediate and unconditional ceasefire in the Gaza Strip (<image:1>). The Security Council Report published on November 19, 2024, discusses a draft resolution on the war in Gaza between Israel and Hamas. The US was expected to vote on the draft resolution on November 20.

The United Nations Security Council failed to adopt a resolution calling for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza due to a veto by the United States on November 20, 2024. The resolution, supported by 14 Council members, also demanded the release of hostages and access to basic services for Gaza's civilian population.

Relevant URLs: [https://news.un.org/en/story/2024/11/1157216](https://news.un.org/en/story/2024/11/1157216), [https://www.securitycouncilreport.org/whatsinblue/2024/11/vote-on-a-draft-resolution-on-the-war-in-gaza.php](https://www.securitycouncilreport.org/whatsinblue/2024/11/vote-on-a-draft-resolution-on-the-war-in-gaza.php), [https://press.un.org/en/2024/sc15907.doc.htm](https://press.un.org/en/2024/sc15907.doc.htm).

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conscription_in_the_United_States): 
Content: The Wikipedia article "Conscription in the United States" details the history of the draft in the US, including its use in World War I, World War II, the Korean War, and the Vietnam War. It provides statistics on the number of draftees during these conflicts. The article also mentions the Selective Service System and the legal framework for conscription, including the role of the National Guard and the unorganized militia. It does not mention the US reinstituting the draft in 2024.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.



## Decision Options
* `misleading`: The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the claim or image is misrepresented in a wrong context or the necessary context is omitted. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way. If the claim refers to an image, it misrepresents the origin, content and/or meaning of the image.If the claim is a text-only claim, i.e. it does not refer to an image, it misrepresents the origin, content, and/or meaning of a statement.
* `not enough information`: The claim is marked as NEI when there is not enough evidence to verify the claim or if the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory. 
* `false`: The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

The Rock's statement on the Israel-Palestine conflict
-----------------------------------------------------

"I'm heartbroken, angry, and sickened by the brutal murders and kidnapping of Jewish people through the horrific acts of the Hamas terrorist group," he began.

"The growing loss of innocent Israeli and Palestinian lives is heart-wrenching as this war escalates to immense proportions.

"I don't pretend to know everything about the complex conflict in the Middle East. Why are Israel and Palestine at war?](https://www.marca.com/en/lifestyle/world-news/2023/10/08/6522d5e4268e3e011e8b4576.html?intcmp=MNOT23801&s_kw=3)

![Does Dwayne Johnson Support Israel? - Shop Israel](//shopisrael.com/cdn/shop/articles/does-dwayne-johnson-support-israel-600395.png?v=1739937114&width=960)

**Key Takeaways**

*   Dwayne Johnson has not been noted for direct engagements with Israel, such as visits or events, but has expressed his views on the Israel-Palestine conflict.
*   He has made public statements condemning terrorism and expressing sympathy for innocent lives lost in the conflict.
*   Johnson's overall stance on Israel is not explicitly supportive or critical, but he emphasizes compassion and peace.

Dwayne Johnson is a globally recognized figure, known for his career in both professional wrestling and Hollywood. The question of whether Dwayne Johnson supports Israel is complex, given his recent statements on the Israel-Palestine conflict. Does Dwayne Johnson Support Israel?

### Has Dwayne Johnson Engaged with Israel Directly?

Dwayne Johnson has not been reported to have engaged directly with Israel through visits or personal connections. His stance on Israel is not explicitly supportive or critical but emphasizes the importance of peace and compassion.

*   Johnson's overall political alignment is not strongly affiliated with any particular side in the Israel/Palestine conflict, as he tends to focus on broader humanitarian concerns.
*   Key points about his stance:
    *   He condemns terrorism and supports peace.
    *   Johnson does not explicitly support or criticize either side in the conflict.

### Community Engagement and Advocacy

Dwayne Johnson is known for his philanthropic efforts, but these have not specifically targeted Israel or Israeli organizations. His advocacy focuses more on general humanitarian causes.

*   Johnson has not undertaken any charitable or advocacy work specifically related to Israel.
*   His community engagement and advocacy efforts are generally aimed at broader social issues rather than specific national or political causes.

### Cultural Impact Related to Israel

Dwayne Johnson's influence on cultural perceptions of Israel is minimal, as his public persona and actions have not been directly associated with Israeli cultural initiatives or events.

*   Johnson's cultural contributions and endorsements have not specifically resonated in Israel or impacted local Israeli cultural initiatives.
*   His influence is more aligned with global entertainment and humanitarian efforts rather than specific cultural engagements with Israel.

### Conclusion: Dwayne Johnson’s Relationship with Israel

Dwayne Johnson's relationship with Israel is not characterized by direct engagement or explicit political support. His public life is more focused on his entertainment career and philanthropic efforts rather than political or cultural engagements with specific countries.

*   There are no documented instances of Dwayne Johnson visiting Israel or participating in events specifically related to Israeli culture or politics.
*   Johnson's professional and personal life has not included any notable collaborations or ties with Israeli communities or organizations.

### Has Dwayne Johnson Expressed Opinions on Israel?

Dwayne Johnson has expressed his views on the Israel-Palestine conflict, emphasizing the need for peace and condemning acts of terrorism.

*   He has made public statements condemning the brutal acts of terrorism and expressing sympathy for the loss of innocent lives on both sides of the conflict.
*   Johnson has not participated in specific discussions or events focused solely on Israeli affairs but has used his platform to advocate for peace and compassion.

### What Is Dwayne Johnson’s Stance on Politics and Israel?

Dwayne Johnson's political perspective is generally neutral, focusing more on humanitarian issues than political alignments. Therefore, it can be concluded that while Johnson does not actively support or criticize Israel, his focus is on promoting peace and compassion in the conflict.

!Gal Gadot, Dwayne Johnson, Natalie Portman <image:2700>

Getty

Hollywood stars are showing their support for Israel, after Hamas launched a surprise attack this past weekend, firing thousands of rockets from Gaza that have killed at least 900 people with more than 100 civilians kidnapped and held hostage.

The attack, which occurred early Saturday morning on Shabbat and coincided with the Jewish high holiday of Simchat Torah, is being called “Israel’s 9/11” and is the deadliest day in Israel in 50 years. Gal Gadot, Madonna, Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson, Natalie Portman, Andy Cohen, Jamie Lee Curtis, Debra Messing, Amy Schumer, Sarah Silverman, Kris Jenner, Mindy Kaling and Meghan McCain are among the celebrities who have taken to social media to stand alongside Israel.

Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds have donated $1 million to help children in Israel and Gaza, sources tell _Variety_.

“I stand with Israel you should too,” [Gadot posted](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyHF5n1t322/)
. “The growing loss of innocent Israeli and Palestinian lives is heart wrenching as this war escalates to immense proportions.”

> [View this post on Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyPX7z8L-Sz/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)
> 
> [A post shared by Dwayne Johnson (@therock)](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyPX7z8L-Sz/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)

Madonna [posted a video](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyI29uYO0bh/?hl=en)
 on her Instagram showing footage of rockets and slain bodies on the streets of Israel. Nine American citizens are among the climbing death toll.

### Popular on Variety

Over the weekend, President Joe Biden condemned the terrorist attack and supported Israel’s right to defend itself. “The United States unequivocally condemns this appalling assault against Israel by Hamas terrorists from Gaza, and I made clear to Prime Minister Netanyahu that we stand ready to offer all appropriate means of support to the Government and people of Israel. “My Administration’s support for Israel’s security is rock solid and unwavering.”

Israel ordered a “complete siege” of Gaza on Monday, cutting off all electricity, food and water to the area. More than 500 Palestinians have been killed by Israel airstrikes, in response to the Hamas attack.

Now, some of Hollywood’s biggest stars are speaking up to lend their support to Israel. What a horrific day.”

Selma Blair, who is Jewish, commented on social media to offer her unwavering support to Israel and Jews around the world. I stand with Israel.”

> [View this post on Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyLj3NoRpu4/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)
> 
> [A post shared by NFL (@nfl)](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyLj3NoRpu4/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)

Both the [NBA](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyLj3NoRpu4/)
 and [MLB](https://twitter.com/MLB/status/1711439508825157770?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Etweet)
 have showed strong signs of support, posting statements from the leagues’ official accounts to condemn terrorism and mourn the loss of lives in Israel.

Former New York Knicks star Amar’e Stoudemire — who converted to Judaism and is an Israeli-American citizen — [posted a video on Instagram](https://twitter.com/TheDunkCentral/status/1711152518045008120?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1711152518045008120%7Ctwgr%5E4c100637d6e5161037d549d6c23fa66d3555bc1b%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fnypost.com%2F2023%2F10%2F09%2Famare-stoudemire-rips-politicians-blm-over-israel-silence%2F)
 to denounce those are staying silent amid Hamas’ attacks on Jews.

“I woke up, man, this morning with some disturbing news out of Israel — that Hamas kidnapping children, putting them in cages, killing women, killing the elderly. I pray that all involved are able to find a resolution.”)

> [View this post on Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyOZm4gpWRN/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)
> 
> [A post shared by UTA (@unitedtalent)](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyOZm4gpWRN/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)

The major talent agencies in Hollywood — UTA, CAA and WME — have all taken public stances to stand with Israel and to support Jews.

WME said it will [match employee donations](https://www.instagram.com/p/CyO3Tcqy1nm/?hl=en&img_index=1)
 to organizations funding relief in Israel and Palestine.

The Royals have also lent their support to Israel.

Britain’s King Charles condemned the “barbaric acts of terrorism,” via a spokesperson from Buckingham Palace.

A spokesperson for Prince William and Kate Middleton commented: “The Prince and Princess of Wales are profoundly distressed by the devastating events that have unfolded in the past days."

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim

## Web Sources

Content: The search result from Marca.com, published on October 11, 2023, discusses Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson's views on the Israel-Palestine war. <image:2699> Johnson expressed his heartbreak and outrage at the events, condemning the actions of Hamas and mentioning the loss of innocent lives on both sides. The article does not show Johnson wearing the Israeli flag.


From [Source](https://shopisrael.com/blogs/support/does-dwayne-johnson-support-israel?srsltid=AfmBOopy4n2f7lxTWWqdiE6_xSd1XeW0AbQOVlP76nNPJQ6KrktIHL3X):

He has made public statements condemning terrorism and expressing sympathy for innocent lives lost in the conflict. The article also mentions that Dwayne Johnson posted on Instagram in support of Israel.

The article also mentions that Dwayne Johnson posted on Instagram in support of Israel. The image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag (<image:64>) is not mentioned in the articles.

The article from Marca.com, published on October 11, 2023, discusses Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson's views on the Israel-Palestine war. The article does not show Johnson wearing the Israeli flag. The article from Shop Israel discusses Dwayne Johnson's stance on Israel and was published on February 28, 2025.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:64> This is an authentic image of Dwayne Johnson waring the Israeli flag in support of Israel."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:64>)
web_search("Dwayne Johnson Israel support")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson has expressed his views on the Israel-Palestine conflict, condemning terrorism and expressing sympathy for innocent lives lost. An article from Variety, published on October 9, 2023, reports that Johnson has shown support for Israel amid the conflict. The article also mentions that Dwayne Johnson posted on Instagram in support of Israel. The image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag (<image:64>) is not mentioned in the articles.

The article from Marca.com, published on October 11, 2023, discusses Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson's views on the Israel-Palestine war. The article does not show Johnson wearing the Israeli flag. The article from Shop Israel discusses Dwayne Johnson's stance on Israel and was published on February 28, 2025.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.



## Decision Options
* `misleading`: The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the claim or image is misrepresented in a wrong context or the necessary context is omitted. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way. If the claim refers to an image, it misrepresents the origin, content and/or meaning of the image.If the claim is a text-only claim, i.e. it does not refer to an image, it misrepresents the origin, content, and/or meaning of a statement.
* `not enough information`: The claim is marked as NEI when there is not enough evidence to verify the claim or if the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory. 
* `false`: The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:64> This is an authentic image of Dwayne Johnson waring the Israeli flag in support of Israel."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:64>)
web_search("Dwayne Johnson Israel support")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson has expressed his views on the Israel-Palestine conflict, condemning terrorism and expressing sympathy for innocent lives lost. An article from Variety, published on October 9, 2023, reports that Johnson has shown support for Israel amid the conflict. The article also mentions that Dwayne Johnson posted on Instagram in support of Israel. The image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag (<image:64>) is not mentioned in the articles.

The article from Marca.com, published on October 11, 2023, discusses Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson's views on the Israel-Palestine war. The article does not show Johnson wearing the Israeli flag. The article from Shop Israel discusses Dwayne Johnson's stance on Israel and was published on February 28, 2025.
*   [https://www.marca.com/en/lifestyle/world-news/2023/10/11/6526c4cc22601d2d748b45da.html](https://www.marca.com/en/lifestyle/world-news/2023/10/11/6526c4cc22601d2d748b45da.html)
*   [https://shopisrael.com/blogs/support/does-dwayne-johnson-support-israel?srsltid=AfmBOopy4n2f7lxTWWqdiE6\_xSd1XeW0AbQOVlP76nNPJQ6KrktIHL3X](https://shopisrael.com/blogs/support/does-dwayne-johnson-support-israel?srsltid=AfmBOopy4n2f7lxTWWqdiE6_xSd1XeW0AbQOVlP76nNPJQ6KrktIHL3X)
*   [https://variety.com/2023/film/news/hollywood-stars-support-israel-palestine-conflict-1235749537/](https://variety.com/2023/film/news/hollywood-stars-support-israel-palestine-conflict-1235749537/)


## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that Dwayne Johnson has expressed support for Israel. However, the provided articles do not mention the specific image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag. Therefore, the authenticity of the image cannot be verified based on the provided evidence.



# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search results confirm that Dwayne Johnson has expressed support for Israel. However, the provided articles do not mention the specific image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag. Therefore, the claim that the image is authentic cannot be verified.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.



## Decision Options
* `misleading`: The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the claim or image is misrepresented in a wrong context or the necessary context is omitted. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way. If the claim refers to an image, it misrepresents the origin, content and/or meaning of the image.If the claim is a text-only claim, i.e. it does not refer to an image, it misrepresents the origin, content, and/or meaning of a statement.
* `not enough information`: The claim is marked as NEI when there is not enough evidence to verify the claim or if the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory. 
* `false`: The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

## Claim

### Evidence from `web_search`
Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson has expressed his views on the Israel-Palestine conflict, condemning terrorism and expressing sympathy for innocent lives lost. An article from Variety, published on October 9, 2023, reports that Johnson has shown support for Israel amid the conflict. The article also mentions that Dwayne Johnson posted on Instagram in support of Israel. The image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag (<image:64>) is not mentioned in the articles.

The article from Marca.com, published on October 11, 2023, discusses Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson's views on the Israel-Palestine war. The article does not show Johnson wearing the Israeli flag. The article from Shop Israel discusses Dwayne Johnson's stance on Israel and was published on February 28, 2025.
*   [https://www.marca.com/en/lifestyle/world-news/2023/10/11/6526c4cc22601d2d748b45da.html](https://www.marca.com/en/lifestyle/world-news/2023/10/11/6526c4cc22601d2d748b45da.html)

## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that Dwayne Johnson has expressed support for Israel. However, the provided articles do not mention the specific image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag. Therefore, the authenticity of the image cannot be verified based on the provided evidence.

```

### Evidence from `image_search`

Content: WIONews published an article about Dwayne Johnson's views on the Israel-Hamas conflict. The article includes an image of Dwayne Johnson with a statement condemning terrorism and expressing sympathy for innocent victims. <image:2711>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that Dwayne Johnson has expressed his views on the Israel-Hamas conflict. However, the image search results do not include the image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag. The provided image shows Dwayne Johnson with a statement condemning terrorism and expressing sympathy for innocent victims. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified.

===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search results confirm that Dwayne Johnson has expressed support for Israel and condemned terrorism. However, the image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag is not mentioned in the articles. The image search results do not include the image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: image_search()

```

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

From [Source](https://www.michigandaily.com/news/campus-life/how-the-rock-became-a-canvas-for-israel-palestine-expressions-on-u-m-campus/): 
Content: "5 when the words “Fuck Israel” were painted over a Pride flag painted the previous day. 

The rock was originally painted with the Palestinian flag on May 21 as part of a [protest](https://www.michigandaily.com/news/hundreds-march-across-ann-arbor-in-solidarity-with-palestine/)
 in support of Palestinian people, according the LSA junior Salma Hamamy said. “We are met, time and time again, with people coming to paint over the rock and silence our voices and write hateful messages, yet no one ever says anything.”

Hamamy was part of a WhatsApp groupchat of a few dozen Arab students who were the ones mainly responsible for the Palestinian paintings on the rock, she said. 

Pro-Israel messages on the Rock included “Israel wants peace” and “Stop Jewish hate” painted in the blue and white colors of the Israeli flag, as well as stars of David that represent both the flag and the Jewish faith.  

The paint disputes extended beyond just the Rock. They were just very persistent about covering up the Israel flag.” 

After an argument, Stoloff and Kalonymos came to the agreement that Kalonymos could paint over the Israeli flag with white spray paint, which would later be covered by the pride flag wrapped around the entire rock. 

“We didn’t want anything to escalate, so we agreed,” Kalonymos said, “So my friends and I painted this light box with Palestinian civil flags. When Hamamy’s WhatsApp group chat saw the Pride flag, it was agreed that there would be no more painting of the rock during Pride month. 

Saturday morning, Stoloff got out of the shower and opened her phone to a text with an image of the Rock. <image:2712>
    
    The Rock was painted with pro-Palestinian messages on May 21, 2021. <image:2714>
    
    The Rock was painted with pro-Palestinian messages on May 23, 2021. <image:2716>
    
    Graffiti Alley was painted with pro-Palestinian messages on May 26, 2021. <image:2717>
    
    Graffiti Alley was painted with pro-Palestinian messages on May 26, 2021. <image:2720>
    
    The Rock was painted with pro-Palestinian and anti-Israel messages on May 27, 2021. <image:2721>
    
    Pro-Palestinian and anti-Israel messages on The Rock were painted over with pro-Israel messages on May 27, 2021."

Gal Gadot, Madonna, Dwayne Johnson, Justin Bieber: Celebrities come out to support Israel amid ongoing conflict
===============================================================================================================

By[Sugandha Rawal](/author/sugandha-rawal-101679671157307)

Published on: Oct 13, 2023 08:09 pm IST

[](javascript:void(0); "bookmark")
[](javascript:void(0) "what's app")
[](javascript:void(0) "Share on Facebook")
[](javascript:void(0) "Share on Twitter")
[](javascript:void(0) "Share on Linkdin")

Share Via

[](#)
[](#)
[](#)
[](#)

Copy Link

Several celebrities are using social media to show support for Israel and denounce Hamas’ attack on Israeli civilians which left at least 1,000 people dead.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

From [Gal Gadot](https://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/hollywood/gal-gadot-reacts-to-israeli-palestine-conflict-101696757328407.html)
, Sonam Kapoor, [Gigi Hadid](https://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/hollywood/what-is-gigi-hadid-and-bella-hadids-connection-with-palestine-mohamed-anwar-hadid-101697011221005.html)
 to Dwayne Johnson, celebrities are taking to social media to show their support for [Israel](https://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/indias-position-vis-a-vis-israel-palestine-conflict-101697021932828.html)
 amid the country’s declared war against [Hamas](https://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/israelpalestine-war-live-updates-hamas-jerusalem-benjamin-netanyahu-gaza-strip-lebanon-joe-biden-qatar-101696981753474.html)
 following the attack by the Palestinian militants last weekend. She re-posted a viral infographic via her Instagram Story that stated, “It is absolutely reasonable and logical to be opposed to the Israeli government’s treatment of Palestinians while simultaneously calling for the protection of Jews in Israel and around the world”.

Liev Schreiber
--------------

In his Instagram stories, the Ray Donovan star, 56, shared a post from the organisation StandWithUs, dedicated to opposing anti-semitism, which included an image of the Israeli flag and read, “Now and always, we stand with the people of Israel!” Below the post, he wrote, “We stand with the people of Israel and the IDF in their fight against Hamas and other terrorist groups. I also feel a responsibility to my Jewish friends to make it clear, as I have before: While I have hopes and dreams for Palestinians, none of them include the harm of a Jewish person,” she wrote on Instagram.

Dwayne Johnson
--------------

Actor Dwayne Johnson, aka The Rock, posted a long note, wherein he ‘condemned and denounced terrorism’. He wrote, “I stand with my Israeli friends in the face of these unprovoked, barbaric terrorist attacks. The sanctity of our common humanity will hopefully serve to heal the unimaginable wounds of division.

![](https://www.hindustantimes.com/static-content/1y/ht/1x1.webp)

*   [Hamas](https://www.hindustantimes.com/topic/hamas)
    
*   [Palestine](https://www.hindustantimes.com/topic/palestine)

*   [Sonam Kapoor](https://www.hindustantimes.com/topic/sonam-kapoor)
    
*   [Gigi Hadid](https://www.hindustantimes.com/topic/gigi-hadid)
    
*   [Dwayne Johnson](https://www.hindustantimes.com/topic/dwayne-johnson)
    
*   [Josh Gad](https://www.hindustantimes.com/topic/josh-gad)
    
*   [Madonna](https://www.hindustantimes.com/topic/madonna)
    
*   [Natalie Portman](https://www.hindustantimes.com/topic/natalie-portman)

Copyright © 2025 HT Digital Streams Limited. The celebrities are using their platforms to show support for Israel and denounce Hamas’ attack on Israeli civilians which left at least 1,000 people dead.

 ![Israeli-born Gal Gadot has been one of the most vocal celebrities to speak out about the ongoing conflict](https://www.hindustantimes.com/ht-img/img/2023/10/11/550x309/Gal_Gadot_1697024752244_1697024752431.jpg "Israeli-born Gal Gadot has been one of the most vocal celebrities to speak out about the ongoing conflict")

Israeli-born Gal Gadot has been one of the most vocal celebrities to speak out about the ongoing conflict

Gigi Hadid
----------

Supermodel Gigi Hadid has spoken out about the ongoing conflict between Israel and Palestine, describing it as an “unjustifiable tragedy”. The 28-year-old, who is a person of Palestinian origin herself, wrote on Instagram, “I have deep empathy and heartbreak for the Palestinian struggle and life under occupation; it’s a responsibility I hold daily. The growing loss of innocent Israeli and Palestinian lives is heart wrenching as this war escalates to immense proportions. I pray for all innocent lives.”

Gal Gadot
---------

Israeli-born Gal Gadot has been one of the most vocal celebrities to speak out about the ongoing conflict. The Wonder Woman star, who served two mandatory years in the Israel Defense Forces, took to Instagram to raise her voice, writing, “I stand with Israel, you should too."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Hindustan Times published an article on October 13, 2023, discussing celebrities who have shown support for Israel amid the conflict. The article mentions Dwayne Johnson, Gal Gadot, and Gigi Hadid, among others. Dwayne Johnson posted a note condemning terrorism. The article does not include the image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:64> This is an authentic image of Dwayne Johnson waring the Israeli flag in support of Israel."

```

```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson has expressed his views on the Israel-Palestine conflict, condemning terrorism and expressing sympathy for innocent lives lost. An article from Variety, published on October 9, 2023, reports that Johnson has shown support for Israel amid the conflict. The article also mentions that Dwayne Johnson posted on Instagram in support of Israel. The image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag (<image:64>) is not mentioned in the articles.

The article from Marca.com, published on October 11, 2023, discusses Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson's views on the Israel-Palestine war. The article does not show Johnson wearing the Israeli flag. The article from Shop Israel discusses Dwayne Johnson's stance on Israel and was published on February 28, 2025.

## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that Dwayne Johnson has expressed support for Israel. However, the provided articles do not mention the specific image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag. Therefore, the authenticity of the image cannot be verified based on the provided evidence.

[Mena](https://gulfnews.com/world/mena)

Memes of Israelis holding flags in front Dome of the Rock circulate on Facebook
===============================================================================

Palestinians and Jordanians to respond to this trend

Last updated: September 15, 2018 | 20:05

[Nasouh Nazzal, Correspondent](/author/nasouh-nazzal-correspondent)

2 MIN READ

![Memes of Israelis holding flags in front Dome of the Rock circulate on Facebook](//media.assettype.com/gulfnews%2Fimport%2F2016%2F7%2F20%2F1_16a080e42e8.1865803_1200962361_16a080e42e8_large.jpg?w=480&auto=format%2Ccompress&fit=max)

Ramallah: New facebook memes in which Israelis post photoshopped images of themselves with Israeli flags in front of the Dome of the Rock are doing rounds on the social media.

The Jewish Press reported that the trend began when Haim Brosh shared a photoshopped image of himself holding the Israeli flag in front of the Dome of the Rock, with the title of the Zionist song “Carry a flag unto Zion” and a call for the Israeli government to finally raise the Israeli flag on Al Haram Al Sharif.

The Israeli police arrested Brosh for half an hour for questioning and later advised him to cease his subversive activities and released him instantly.

“How bored are the Israel police,” Brosh wrote on his facebook page after his release.

Since then, images of many Israelis holding their flag in front of the Dome of the Rock are circulating on the social media with huge public support and the Israeli police incapable to even summon those people for questioning. “We will figure out the right response to answer to this fierce campaign,” he told Gulf News.

“Raising the Israeli flag on the Dome of the Rock is the Zionist lifetime dream that will never come true.”

He said that the speakers of Al Aqsa Mosque and the other mosques have been instructed to highlight the Muslim origin of Al Haram Al Sharif as a pure and undisputed Muslim property.

He said that after the Israeli occupation forces captured Al Haram Al Sharif in 1967 Mideast war, the Israeli government signed the status quo agreements according to which Jews are allowed to visit but banned from praying in the holy shrine.

* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.



## Decision Options
* `misleading`: The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the claim or image is misrepresented in a wrong context or the necessary context is omitted. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way. If the claim refers to an image, it misrepresents the origin, content and/or meaning of the image.If the claim is a text-only claim, i.e. it does not refer to an image, it misrepresents the origin, content, and/or meaning of a statement.
* `not enough information`: The claim is marked as NEI when there is not enough evidence to verify the claim or if the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory. 
* `false`: The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:64> This is an authentic image of Dwayne Johnson waring the Israeli flag in support of Israel."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:64>)
web_search("Dwayne Johnson Israel support")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson has expressed his views on the Israel-Palestine conflict, condemning terrorism and expressing sympathy for innocent lives lost. An article from Variety, published on October 9, 2023, reports that Johnson has shown support for Israel amid the conflict. The article also mentions that Dwayne Johnson posted on Instagram in support of Israel. The image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag (<image:64>) is not mentioned in the articles.

The article from Marca.com, published on October 11, 2023, discusses Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson's views on the Israel-Palestine war. The article does not show Johnson wearing the Israeli flag. The article from Shop Israel discusses Dwayne Johnson's stance on Israel and was published on February 28, 2025.
*   [https://www.marca.com/en/lifestyle/world-news/2023/10/11/6526c4cc22601d2d748b45da.html](https://www.marca.com/en/lifestyle/world-news/2023/10/11/6526c4cc22601d2d748b45da.html)
*   [https://shopisrael.com/blogs/support/does-dwayne-johnson-support-israel?srsltid=AfmBOopy4n2f7lxTWWqdiE6\_xSd1XeW0AbQOVlP76nNPJQ6KrktIHL3X](https://shopisrael.com/blogs/support/does-dwayne-johnson-support-israel?srsltid=AfmBOopy4n2f7lxTWWqdiE6_xSd1XeW0AbQOVlP76nNPJQ6KrktIHL3X)
*   [https://variety.com/2023/film/news/hollywood-stars-support-israel-palestine-conflict-1235749537/](https://variety.com/2023/film/news/hollywood-stars-support-israel-palestine-conflict-1235749537/)


## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that Dwayne Johnson has expressed support for Israel. However, the provided articles do not mention the specific image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag. Therefore, the authenticity of the image cannot be verified based on the provided evidence.



## Actions
```
image_search("Dwayne Johnson Israeli flag image")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `image_search`
From [Source](https://www.wionews.com/entertainment/dwayne-johnson-on-israel-hamas-conflict-im-heartbroken-angry-and-sickened-645300): 
Content: WIONews published an article about Dwayne Johnson's views on the Israel-Hamas conflict. The article includes an image of Dwayne Johnson with a statement condemning terrorism and expressing sympathy for innocent victims. <image:2711>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that Dwayne Johnson has expressed his views on the Israel-Hamas conflict. However, the image search results do not include the image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag. The provided image shows Dwayne Johnson with a statement condemning terrorism and expressing sympathy for innocent victims. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified.


## Actions
```
web_search("Dwayne Johnson image with Israeli flag origin")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
From [Source](https://www.hindustantimes.com/htcity/cinema/gal-gadot-madonna-dwayne-johnson-justin-bieber-celebrities-come-out-to-support-israel-amid-ongoing-conflict-101697024471665.html): 
Content: The Hindustan Times published an article on October 13, 2023, discussing celebrities who have shown support for Israel amid the conflict. The article mentions Dwayne Johnson, Gal Gadot, and Gigi Hadid, among others. Dwayne Johnson posted a note condemning terrorism. The article does not include the image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag.


## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that Dwayne Johnson has expressed support for Israel. However, the image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag is not mentioned in any of the articles. Therefore, the authenticity of the image cannot be verified based on the provided evidence.


## Final Judgement
The evidence confirms that Dwayne Johnson has expressed support for Israel. However, the image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag is not mentioned in any of the articles. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified. `not enough information`

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The available evidence confirms that Dwayne Johnson has expressed support for Israel, as reported by sources like [Variety](https://variety.com/2023/film/news/hollywood-stars-support-israel-palestine-conflict-1235749537/) and [Hindustan Times](https://www.hindustantimes.com/htcity/cinema/gal-gadot-madonna-dwayne-johnson-justin-bieber-celebrities-come-out-to-support-israel-amid-ongoing-conflict-101697024471665.html). However, none of the provided sources mention or show the specific image of Dwayne Johnson wearing the Israeli flag. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:65> This is an authentic image of an elderly Palestinian women being attacked by an Israeli army dog in June 2024."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
reverse_search(<image:65>)
web_search("Israeli army dog attack Palestinian woman")
```
_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:65> This is an authentic image of an elderly Palestinian women being attacked by an Israeli army dog in June 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:65>)
web_search("Israeli army dog attack Palestinian woman")
```

Israeli Police Dog Attack on Elderly Palestinian Woman Sparks Outrage
=====================================================================

A disturbing leaked video came to light on Tuesday showing an Israeli police dog brutally attacking an elderly Palestinian woman inside her home during their raid of the Jabalia refugee camp several weeks ago.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

!Sara Zouiten <image:2735>by[Sara Zouiten](https://www.moroccoworldnews.com/author/sara-zouiten/)

[Jun, 26, 2024](https://www.moroccoworldnews.com/2024/06/18005/israeli-police-dog-attack-on-elderly-palestinian-woman-sparks-outrage/)

[0](#)

[](//api.whatsapp.com/send?text=Israeli%20Police%20Dog%20Attack%20on%20Elderly%20Palestinian%20Woman%20Sparks%20Outrage%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.moroccoworldnews.com%2F2024%2F06%2F18005%2Fisraeli-police-dog-attack-on-elderly-palestinian-woman-sparks-outrage%2F)
[](https://telegram.me/share/url?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.moroccoworldnews.com%2F2024%2F06%2F18005%2Fisraeli-police-dog-attack-on-elderly-palestinian-woman-sparks-outrage%2F&text=Israeli%20Police%20Dog%20Attack%20on%20Elderly%20Palestinian%20Woman%20Sparks%20Outrage)
 <image:2738>

Rabat – A disturbing leaked video came to light on Tuesday showing an Israeli police dog brutally attacking an elderly Palestinian woman inside her home during their raid of the Jabalia refugee camp several weeks ago.

The **[footage](https://www.instagram.com/p/C8rTeL6pF3M/?igsh=MWRhbzlyYm00Zjl4Ng==)
**, which was obtained by Al Jazeera, has sparked social media fury and widespread condemnation. Captured from a camera mounted on the dog, the video showed the 66-year-old woman screaming in terror as she was viciously attacked.

The elderly woman, identified as Dawlat Al Tanani, suffered severe injuries and fractures as a result of the brutal attack.

Speaking to Al Jazeera, she said that Israeli Occupation Forces (IOF) unleashed the dog on her because she was resisting eviction from her home.

“I refuse to be forced out of my house, nor will I abandon my home. So the Israelis set a dog on me, which bit me while I was sleeping in my bed. It dragged me and pulled me all the way to the entrance door,” the elderly woman said.

“Now I have a serious injury. There are no hospitals or anything to treat my injury. My hand is still untreated,” she added.

The incident has reinforced accusations against the IOF of perpetrating severe forms of torture and violence against civilians, contrasting sharply with its self-proclaimed status as “the most moral army in the world.”

Social media users have widely shared the video, expressing shock for the extent the IOF goes to inflict pain and suffering on Palestinians.

Many activists have pointed out that such actions, including the use of police dogs against civilians, have been a longstanding practice by the Israeli forces.

“Israel/Zionist Occupiers brutality clearly has no limits…training dogs to rape and attack Palestinians. The daily massacres (are) getting (more) gruesome by the day,” **[said](https://x.com/huda54112445811/status/1805989054044938370)
** one social media user.
